concept.title: Step 4: Configure environment variables
concept.shortdesc: The GemFire server requires keys and keystores in the Java Key Store (JKS) format while the native client requires them in the clear PEM format. Because of this, you need to be able to generate private/public keypairs in either format and convert between the two.

conbody.p: This section lists the commands for configuring your system environment to build and run OpenSSL. Follow the environment setup that applies to your operating system. For all references to the NativeClient_xxxx directory, replace the xxxx with the actual four-digit product number.

section.title: Bourne and Korn shells (sh, ksh, bash)
section.codeblock: % OPENSSL=<parent folder for OpenSSL binaries>; export OPENSSL % GFCPP=<path to installation, typically C:\NativeClient_xxxx>; export GFCPP % LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:$GFCPP/lib:$OPENSSL/lib % export LD_LIBRARY_PATH % CLASSPATH=$GEMFIRE/lib/gfSecurityImpl.jar:$CLASSPATH

section.title: Windows
section.codeblock: > set GFCPP=<path to installation, typically C:\NativeClient_xxxx> > set OPENSSL=<path to installed OpenSSL, typically C:\OpenSSL> > set PATH=<path to Java JDK or JRE>\bin;%GFCPP%\bin;%OPENSSL%\bin;%PATH% > set CLASSPATH=<path to GemFire installation>\lib\gfSecurityImpl.jar;%CLASSPATH%
